required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Automated Geriatric Co-Management Program in Older Patients With Solid Mass or Nodule Suspicious for Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility and Effectiveness of Automated Geriatric Co-Management Program on Improving the Perioperative Care of Older Patients With Solid Mass or Nodule Suspicious for Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find out if it is possible to use the automated geriatric co-management program to manage the participants care before, during and after surgery.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The proposed study is a randomized controlled trial study.

primary_outcome.measure: feasibility of automated geriatric co-management program
primary_outcome.description: percentage of recommendations that were followed by the surgery team

intervention.description: The geriatrics service sees these patients for at least 2 postoperative days, if deemed clinically necessary by the geriatrician. During the inpatient hospital course, the geriatrics service will ensure the execution of preoperative recommendations and will discuss with the surgical team, who will act as a primary team, any additional recommendation in order to improve postoperative care.

Following completion of the eRFA, the summary of impairments as well as the recommendations generated by the study team (hard-copy or email) will be provided in real-time to the surgery team for their attention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Solid mass or nodule suspicious for cancer
- Aged 65 or older
- Being considered for surgical resection of the solid mass or nodule, with anticipated hospital length of stay of at least two days,
- Completed the eRFA per routine care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to read or comprehend English
- Not having a completed electronic Rapid Fitness Assessment within 2 months of surgery**Note) To avoid excluding patients based this item, patients have to complete another eRFA within two months of surgery.
- Being discharged in one day or earlier from the hospital.

patient_data.ipd_description: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center supports the international committee of medical journal editors (ICMJE) and the ethical obligation of responsible sharing of data from clinical trials. The protocol summary, a statistical summary, and informed consent form will be made available on clinicaltrials.gov when required as a condition of Federal awards, other agreements supporting the research and/or as otherwise required. Requests for deidentified individual participant data can be made beginning 12 months after publication and for up to 36 months post publication. Deidentified individual participant data reported in the manuscript will be shared under the terms of a Data Use Agreement and may only be used for approved proposals. Requests may be made to: crdatashare@mskcc.org.
